channel.title: Good At Math? Hah Good Luck With This
channel.description:
[code] public int getXPWithFormula(int skillId, int divideBy) { return ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * 99) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId])+1))) / divideBy; } public int getHigherXPWithFormula(int skillId, int multiplyBy) { return ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * 100) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId])+1))) * multiplyBy; } [/code]
Current Max Level In A Stat: 122 Wanted: 99
Good Luck I've failed countless times.

item.title: Good At Math? Hah Good Luck With This
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {

and

return 99;

You can figure out what goes where.

(Just try it and see what happens)

Read full topic
item.source: Good At Math? Hah Good Luck With This

item.title: Good At Math? Hah Good Luck With This
item.dc:creator: @TranScape TranScape
item.description:
@TranScape wrote:

Sorry about posting that got sidetracked with something else. But anyway here is my code

[code] public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 135; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
        if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
        }
    }
    return 135;
}

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Good At Math? Hah Good Luck With This
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

public int getXPWithFormula(int skillId, int divideBy) {
return ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * 99) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId])+1))) / divideBy;
}

Maybe it’s your math? Duh…

And show me int getLevelForXP.

public int getXPWithFormula(int skillId, int divideBy)	{		return ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * 99) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId])+1))) / divideBy;	}		
public int getHigherXPWithFormula(int skillId, int multiplyBy)	{		return ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * 100) + (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId]) * (getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillId])+1))) * multiplyBy;	}
